importantArticles.headline: Comcast has been losing broadband subscribers to wireless giants such as AT&T, T-Mobile and Verizon, which offer plans, bundling internet with high-speed mobile data services, that have proven to be popular with customers.  The offer gives new Xfinity Internet customers plans starting at $55 a month, locked in for five years with no annual contract required.  It also includes a free unlimited wireless line for one year.
importantArticles.title: Comcast unveils five-year internet price lock to stem broadband losses

importantArticles.headline: Investing.com -- Verizon Communications was upgraded to “Outperform” by Evercore ISI, which named it its top pick in the wireless sector, citing improving subscriber trends, fiber growth potential, and a compelling valuation following years of relative underperformance.

importantArticles.headline: Julie Hyman goes over some of Friday's top stories on this segment of Market Minute. Five Below (FIVE) stock is under pressure after the retailer had to ask vendors to hold shipments from China. Lucid Group (LCID) plans to acquire Arizona-based assets from Nikola, pending US Bankruptcy Court approval. Additionally, Verizon (VZ) was upgraded to Outperform from In Line by Evercore ISI. Evercore ISI also lifted its price target for the company to $48 from $44. Stay up to date on the latest market action, minute-by-minute, with Yahoo Finance's Market Minute.
importantArticles.title: Five Below, Lucid Group, Verizon: Market Minute

importantArticles.headline: The Dow Jones Industrial Average (DJINDICES: ^DJI) fell sharply after the U.S. released a new tariff program.  A quick look at the three highest-paying dividend stocks on the index -- Merck (NYSE: MRK), Chevron (NYSE: CVX), and Verizon (NYSE: VZ) -- is a good place to start if you want to find out.  Merck's 4% dividend yield is near the highest levels of the past decade, though it's been much higher in the past.
importantArticles.title: Should You Buy the 3 Highest-Paying Dividend Stocks in the Dow Jones?

importantArticles.headline: The stock market recently took a big dip, driven down by concerns about how much tariffs will affect the economy.  One of the benefits of falling stock prices is that dividend yields move in the opposite direction.
importantArticles.title: Buying the Dip: 3 Super Safe High-Yield Dividend Stocks I Added to My Retirement Account During the Stock Market Sell-Off.

importantArticles.headline: Verizon said an AI assistant for the company's customer service representatives built using Google models had cut down on call times and freed them up to sell products to customers, leading to a surge in sales.  An AI assistant on their screen helps the customer service agents figure out the right answers to customers' queries.  Verizon first started deploying the new AI features in July 2024, ramping them up to full scale in January.
importantArticles.title: Verizon says Google AI for customer service agents has led to sales jump
